Justification: ASML shipped 23 immersion systems to 17 customers in 2006
Sources: marking the start of volume production ramp-up for immersion lithography

Justification: More than 70 immersion systems had been shipped cumulatively by end of 2007
Sources: with 35 immersion systems shipped in 2007 alone

column6: Q3: ~15 (estimated from revenue mix showing 75-80% immersion)
column8: more than 100 cumulative immersion systems had been shipped

Justification: ASML shipped 70 total systems in 2009 during the economic downturn. Immersion represented the majority of technology-focused shipments
Sources: with bookings heavily weighted toward immersion systems

Justification: ASML shipped 197 total systems in 2010. Q4 alone had 27 immersion systems (13 XT:1950 + 14 NXT:1950). By Q1 2010
Sources: more than 180 cumulative immersion systems had been shipped. Immersion orders represented 89% of the order book by end of Q1 2010

Justification: ASML recognized 101 immersion systems in revenue for full year 2011
Sources: with 78 of those being the advanced TWINSCAN NXT:1950i systems
missing their target of 30 due to temporary supply constraints in the NXE:3400C ramp. Six systems were the new NXE:3400C model with higher productivity

Justification: ASML sold 31 EUV systems in 2020 (up from 26 in 2019)
Sources: generating €4.5 billion in EUV revenue. The company celebrated shipping its 100th EUV system by the end of 2020
a significant increase driven by strong logic demand. By end of 2021
column6: 127 EUV machines were in use at customer locations

Justification: ASML recognized revenue for 40 EUV systems in 2022
Sources: though 54 systems were shipped. The difference is due to their "fast shipment" process where 15 systems had deferred revenue recognition into 2023

Justification: ASML recognized revenue for 53 EUV systems in 2023. The company initially planned to ship 60 systems but reduced the forecast. First High NA EUV system (EXE:5000) was shipped to Intel in December 2023

ASML sold 44 EUV systems in 2024 (excluding High NA systems). The company also recognized revenue on 2 High NA EUV systems and shipped a third High NA system in Q4. Total net sales reached €28.3 billion
